intro: Pliogynopsis, commonly known as the genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae, consists of annual and biennial herbs. These plants are characterized by their compound leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. They typically produce small, white or yellow flowers and have a taproot system. Pliogynopsis species are often found in temperate regions and are adapted to various soil types. The genus is notable for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
